job_title: Patient Care Assistant (PCA) in Cookeville, TN
pros: A really great job for those in college pursuing anything in the medical field. For the time I've been here the management has been quick to resolve any issues I had. The weekdays are absolutely balls to the wall busy weekends are more relaxed. if there's a slow weekend it's great time to work on homework.
cons: Some of the veteran PCAs delegate the work instead of pitching in and working together. I would say 30% of the nurses are the mean and really rude, but there are some great ones that will teach you and help you. If you are the kind bubbly type of person doctors, physicians, and nurses will eat you alive. This leaves me having my guard up and fight or flight mode always on.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Cookeville, TN
pros: There are some great staff members. In general, it isn't a terrible working environment day to day. People are friendly and it is a very "hometown hospital" feel. You get to know your patients and coworkers.
cons: Retention is terrible. No one wants to stay here because they trap new grad RNs for the first two years with a contract and then don't offer real raises. (13 cents? Keep it). Wages are some of the lowest in the nation, but they're "competitive" because the whole south is terrible for nurses. Then they hire travel nurses at double our rates to 'fix' staffing. Ratios? Forget about it. They only match your 401k to 3% and even then it's only fully yours if you stay for FIVE YEARS. Also, there are very few techs (they are paid abysmally), and you do all your own phlebotomy and there is no IV team.

review_title: Horrific, backwards, hospital entrenched in city politics which corrupts the entire organization.
job_title: Surgery in Cookeville, TN
pros: Really wish I had something positive to say.  I've worked in several hospitals for many years and this place was the worst by far.
cons: Executive management seems to believe the best way to fund things is by attacking the employee's paychecks - seriously they do things like dramatically increase your benefits deductions to fund capital purchases and expansions they really don't need to remain viable and strong.  They fail to involve middle managers and front line employees in critical decisions.  The workplace culture is out of control - if you are a strong, progressive performer with lots of experience expect your peers to resent you and view you as a threat to their job security rather than embrace you - no matter how respectful, diplomatic, and courteous you are..

review_title: small town hospital with big town attitude
job_title: Therapist in Cookeville, TN
pros: CRMC is a great small hospital located in an area in which the surrounding communities support the hospital. Its a good place to work without having to drive to a big city and deal with big city traffic. It has been my experience that CRMC is competitive in wages and fair when considering relocation assistance and incentive bonuses for job retention.
cons: Management is not very well organized and lack of communication between management and employees is not good. CRMC says that they care about their employees but then focus all of their financial resources on building an extension on the hospital and cutting funding for employee programs such as continuing education and funding for equipment needed to perform your job.

review_title: My CRMC job was very flexible and I appreciated that.
job_title: Biller in Cookeville, TN
pros: All women - I enjoyed the ladies I worked with in the CRMC PFS department. There were only a few catty and mean ladies.
cons:
The pay scale is awful. They do not pay enough for the amount of work they ask for. They don't give raises very often and if they do give a raise the most you can get is 2%. 

They do not pay any thing extra for a college degree if it does not exactly fit into your job description. 

No opportunity to move up.

job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse in Cookeville, TN
pros: They have good benefits. It's a clean place to work
cons: They don't seem to really care about their employees. They started building and expanding and they took employees bonus away. For those employees that were topped out they did not get their yearly bonus or it was reduced by half. I have worked in the other parts of the hospital it is better. They have reduced their employees there's no lab the nurses are already overwhelmed now they've added to that.

review_title: Like every place, it has pros and cons

review_title: An AWFUL place to work...if you despise a highly toxic environment STAY AWAY!
job_title: Phlebotomist in Cookeville, TN
pros: The only pro here is to gain healthcare experience
cons:
Management is non existent.  Those who can't do "manage."
Employees are written up for ANY reason including being written up by fellow employees; yet any positive feedback you get miraculously never makes it on your employee record.
Even with a doctor's note, you are still written up for being out sick and are even threatened with your job despite their claims that if you are sick you need to "stay home."
If you forget your badge to clock in and have to do it manually, you are considered tardy even if you're in early.
Poor behavior is rewarded while those who work hard and strive to make a difference are always being brought down.
The cutbacks the hospital is making are absolutely sickening.  Instead of cutting doctor's perks, FAT six figure salaries, ceasing the purchase of properties and buildings they DON'T need, they are cutting out vital hospital services such as phlebotomists, respiratory therapists, housekeeping etc.  These additional duties are now the responsibility of an already overworked nursing staff; a true recipe for human disaster.  And despite these drastic cuts to vital services, they STILL cry poverty while claiming that "patient care is their number one priority."

review_title: Not told part time job I applied for a month prior had turned into a full time job.
